ABOUT

Current meeting location:

Who are we?
We are a Toastmasters club.
You can call us an oratory hub.
Once every week,
We gather to speak
And afterwards grab some grub.

What are we like?
Students, staff, and alumni,
A monk, a priest and a rabbi,
You needn’t fear
We’ve got them all here
So you’ll fit right in when you come by

Interested? Come to our meetings or send us an email (info.varistytoastmasters@gmail.com). Check out the “Meetings” tab on our website to get further details on meeting times and location. Join us on Facebook, where you can get up-to-date information about the club and chat with a current member.

FAQ

What's the difference between Biztalk and Varsity?

Varsity is Auckland University's original Toastmasters club. We were so popular, Biztalk had to be created to ensure everyone had a chance to speak. They are two independent clubs, run and attended by different people.

Why should I join this club?

Because we're fast and loose. If you're interested in listening to some squares talk about conflict resoltuion in the work place or whatever, look elsewhere.

What does 'Varsity' mean?

You uncultured swine! It refers to university. The club is called this because it's a toastmasters club at a varsity
